intro: Agrostomia barbata, commonly known as the hairy beardtongue, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, hairy, and often blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in sunny to partially shaded environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its unique appearance. Agrostomia barbata is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and slopes.
